Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Women's Issues

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Women's Issues

Resolution in support of S.3666/A.5890, which would amend the penal and criminal procedure law, as well as the family court act, by: (i) creating the crimes of domestic abuse in the first and second degrees; (ii) providing for deferral of sentencing in felony domestic abuse offenses pending court ordered treatment; and (iii) granting criminal courts and family courts concurrent jurisdiction over domestic abuse offenses.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Creating the crimes of domestic abuse in the first and second degrees; (ii) providing for deferral of sentencing in felony domestic abuse offenses pending court ordered treatment; and (iii) granting criminal courts and family courts concurrent jurisdictio

Items.Title: Resolution in support of S.1003-A/A.2494-B, which would amend the Criminal Procedure Law and the Family Court Act by requiring judges in criminal and family court proceedings to inquire as to the possession of a firearm by a defendant or respondent when an order of protection is issued.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Requiring judges in criminal and family court proceedings to inquire as to the possession of a firearm by a defendant or respondent when an order of protection is issued. (S.1003-A/A.2494-B)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.6113/S.1870, an act to amend the Family Court Act and the Criminal Procedure Law, in relation to the duties of interpreters appointed by the courts in certain cases.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Duties of interpreters appointed by the courts in certain cases. (A.6113/S.1870)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of pending legislation in the New York State Legislature, which would amend the Penal and Criminal Procedure Laws by creating the E felony of aggravated domestic violence when an offender is convicted of two or more specified domestic violence offenses within five years.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Creating the E felony of aggravated domestic violence when an offender is convicted of two or more specified domestic violence offenses within five years.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Children and Family Services to extend the maximum length of stay at emergency shelter residential programs for victims of domestic violence to not less than 180 days.
